wikipedia_page.main: John Abercromby, 5th Baron Abercromby of Tullibody  (15 January 1841 – 7 October 1924) was a Scottish soldier and archaeologist.

response: *John Abercromby, 5th Baron Abercromby (1841–1924), Scottish soldier and president of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland

link_mentions.page: John Abercromby, 5th Baron Abercromby of Aboukir and Tullibody

response: Abercromby Professorship of Archaeology is a chair at the University of Edinburgh. It was endowed in the will of John Abercromby, 5th Baron Abercromby (1841–1924), who left instructions to establish a chair in prehistoric archaeology at the university. With the new post having been advertised, it was filled for the first time in 1927 by V. Gordon Childe. Abercromby's will set out the focus of the chair and requirements of its holder: they should be knowledgable of the prehistory of Europe and of the Near East, and that the professor would be actively involved in archaeology research.
